sentence.Network_en: He fastidiously copied every word of his notes on to clean paper.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一丝不苟地将笔记里的每一个字抄到空白纸上。

sentence.Network_en: Ernestine kept her daughters fastidiously clean.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧内斯廷把女儿打点得过于干净了。
该过程被近乎挑剔般地核对过了.

entry.tran: 讲究的;一丝不苟的;注重细节的
entry.def: If you say that someone is fastidious, you mean that they pay great attention to detail because they like everything to be very neat, accurate, and in good order.

example.tran: 她对历史细节的过分关注

example.ex: He was fastidious about his appearance.

entry.tran: 过分讲究整洁的;有洁癖的
entry.def: If you say that someone is fastidious, you mean that they are concerned about keeping clean to an extent that many people consider to be excessive.

example.ex: Be particularly fastidious about washing your hands before touching food.
example.tran: 接触食物前尤其对洗手不能有半点马虎。

means.word_mean: 1. in a fastidious and painstaking manner;

sentences.sentence: "it is almost a waste of time painstakingly to learn the routines of selling"
"he writes extremely musical music, of which the sound is fastidiously calculated and yet agreeably spontaneous and imaginative"

auth_sentence.content: It's always better to split an infinitive than to fastidiously avoid one and thereby say something clumsy or opaque.

auth_sentence.content: You are a fastidiously organised woman who has bought all her Christmas gifts in the summer sale.
auth_sentence.res_content: You are a fastidiously organised woman who has bought all her Christmas gifts in the summer sale.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You are a fastidiously organised woman who has bought all her Christmas gifts in the summer sale.

auth_sentence.content: Mr. Morgan is fastidiously ecumenical, but he does note, rather oddly, Don't expect ethnic dress at a Jewish wedding.
